TypeSignature.Value: Public NotInheritable Class MediaCodecInfo.CodecCapabilities Inherits Object
public: ref class MediaCodecInfo::CodecCapabilities sealed : Java::Lang::Object
.class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MediaCodecInfo/CodecCapabilities extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the capabilities of a given codec component.

remarks.para: Encapsulates the capabilities of a given codec component. For example, what profile/level combinations it supports and what colorspaces it is capable of providing the decoded data in, as well as some codec-type specific capability flags.
You can get an instance for a given MediaCodecInfo object with MediaCodecInfo#getCapabilitiesForType getCapabilitiesForType(), passing a MIME type.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: 16 bits per pixel RGB color format, with 5-bit red & blue and 6-bit green component.

remarks.para: 16 bits per pixel RGB color format, with 5-bit red & blue and 6-bit green component.
Using 16-bit little-endian representation, colors stored as Red 15:11, Green 10:5, Blue 4:0.
This format corresponds to android.graphics.PixelFormat#RGB_565 and android.graphics.ImageFormat#RGB_565.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: 24 bits per pixel RGB color format, with 8-bit red, green & blue components.

remarks.para: 24 bits per pixel RGB color format, with 8-bit red, green & blue components.
Using 24-bit little-endian representation, colors stored as Red 7:0, Green 15:8, Blue 23:16.
This format corresponds to android.graphics.PixelFormat#RGB_888, and can also be represented as a flexible format by #COLOR_FormatRGBFlexible.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: 32 bits per pixel RGBA color format, with 10-bit red, green, blue, and 2-bit alpha components.

remarks.para: 32 bits per pixel RGBA color format, with 10-bit red, green, blue, and 2-bit alpha components.
Using 32-bit little-endian representation, colors stored as Red 9:0, Green 19:10, Blue 29:20, and Alpha 31:30.
This corresponds to android.graphics.PixelFormat#RGBA_1010102.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: 32 bits per pixel RGBA color format, with 8-bit red, green, blue, and alpha components.

remarks.para: 32 bits per pixel RGBA color format, with 8-bit red, green, blue, and alpha components.
Using 32-bit little-endian representation, colors stored as Red 7:0, Green 15:8, Blue 23:16, and Alpha 31:24.
This corresponds to android.graphics.PixelFormat#RGBA_8888.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Flexible 32 bits per pixel RGBA color format with 8-bit red, green, blue, and alpha components.

remarks.para: Flexible 32 bits per pixel RGBA color format with 8-bit red, green, blue, and alpha components.

Use this format with Image. This format corresponds to android.graphics.ImageFormat#FLEX_RGBA_8888, and can represent #COLOR_Format32bitBGRA8888, #COLOR_Format32bitABGR8888 and #COLOR_Format32bitARGB8888 formats.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Flexible 24 bits per pixel RGB color format with 8-bit red, green and blue components.

remarks.para: Flexible 24 bits per pixel RGB color format with 8-bit red, green and blue components.
Use this format with Image. This format corresponds to android.graphics.ImageFormat#FLEX_RGB_888, and can represent #COLOR_Format24bitBGR888 and #COLOR_Format24bitRGB888 formats.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ColorFormats As IList(Of Integer)

member this.ColorFormats : System.Collections.Generic.IList<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: The color format for the media.

remarks.para: The color format for the media. This is one of the color constants defined in this class.

Docs.summary: Flexible 12 bits per pixel, subsampled YUV color format with 8-bit chroma and luma components.

remarks.para: Flexible 12 bits per pixel, subsampled YUV color format with 8-bit chroma and luma components.

Chroma planes are subsampled by 2 both horizontally and vertically. Use this format with Image. This format corresponds to android.graphics.ImageFormat#YUV_420_888, and can represent the #COLOR_FormatYUV411Planar, #COLOR_FormatYUV411PackedPlanar, #COLOR_FormatYUV420Planar, #COLOR_FormatYUV420PackedPlanar, #COLOR_FormatYUV420SemiPlanar and #COLOR_FormatYUV420PackedSemiPlanar formats.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Flexible 16 bits per pixel, subsampled YUV color format with 8-bit chroma and luma components.

remarks.para: Flexible 16 bits per pixel, subsampled YUV color format with 8-bit chroma and luma components.

Chroma planes are horizontally subsampled by 2. Use this format with Image. This format corresponds to android.graphics.ImageFormat#YUV_422_888, and can represent the #COLOR_FormatYCbYCr, #COLOR_FormatYCrYCb, #COLOR_FormatCbYCrY, #COLOR_FormatCrYCbY, #COLOR_FormatYUV422Planar, #COLOR_FormatYUV422PackedPlanar, #COLOR_FormatYUV422SemiPlanar and #COLOR_FormatYUV422PackedSemiPlanar formats.

Docs.summary: Flexible 24 bits per pixel YUV color format with 8-bit chroma and luma components.

remarks.para: Flexible 24 bits per pixel YUV color format with 8-bit chroma and luma components.
Chroma planes are not subsampled. Use this format with Image. This format corresponds to android.graphics.ImageFormat#YUV_444_888, and can represent the #COLOR_FormatYUV444Interleaved format.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: P010 is 10-bit-per component 4:2:0 YCbCr semiplanar format.

remarks.para: P010 is 10-bit-per component 4:2:0 YCbCr semiplanar format.

This format uses 24 allocated bits per pixel with 15 bits of data per pixel. Chroma planes are subsampled by 2 both horizontally and vertically. Each chroma and luma component has 16 allocated bits in little-endian configuration with 10 MSB of actual data.
Use this format with Image. This format corresponds to android.graphics.ImageFormat#YCBCR_P010.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EncoderCapabilities As MediaCodecInfo.EncoderCapabilities

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video decoder only: codec supports seamless resolution changes.

remarks.para: video decoder only: codec supports seamless resolution changes.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: If true, the timestamp of each output buffer is derived from the timestamp of the input buffer that produced the output.

remarks.para: If true, the timestamp of each output buffer is derived from the timestamp of the input buffer that produced the output. If false, the timestamp of each output buffer is derived from the timestamp of the first input buffer.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video encoder only: codec supports exporting encoding statistics.

remarks.para: video encoder only: codec supports exporting encoding statistics. Encoders with this feature can provide the App clients with the encoding statistics information about the frame. The scope of encoding statistics is controlled by MediaFormat#KEY_VIDEO_ENCODING_STATISTICS_LEVEL.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: decoder onlyIf true, the codec supports partial (including multiple) access units per input buffer.

remarks.para: decoder onlyIf true, the codec supports partial (including multiple) access units per input buffer.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video encoder only: codec supports HDR editing.

remarks.para: video encoder only: codec supports HDR editing.

HDR editing support means that the codec accepts 10-bit HDR input surface, and it is capable of generating any HDR metadata required from both YUV and RGB input when the metadata is not present. This feature is only meaningful when using an HDR capable profile (and 10-bit HDR input).

This feature implies that the codec is capable of encoding at least one HDR format, and that it supports RGBA_1010102 as well as P010, and optionally RGBA_FP16 input formats, and that the encoder can generate HDR metadata for all supported HDR input formats.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video encoder only: codec supports intra refresh.

remarks.para: video encoder only: codec supports intra refresh.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: decoder only: codec supports low latency decoding.

remarks.para: decoder only: codec supports low latency decoding. If supported, clients can enable the low latency mode for the decoder. When the mode is enabled, the decoder doesn't hold input and output data more than required by the codec standards.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: If true, the codec supports multiple access units (for decoding, or to output for encoders).

remarks.para: If true, the codec supports multiple access units (for decoding, or to output for encoders). If false, the codec only supports single access units. Producing multiple access units for output is an optional feature.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video decoder only: codec supports queuing partial frames.

remarks.para: video decoder only: codec supports queuing partial frames.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video encoder only: codec supports quantization parameter bounds.

remarks.para: video encoder only: codec supports quantization parameter bounds.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video decoder only: codec supports secure decryption.

remarks.para: video decoder only: codec supports secure decryption.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: video or audio decoder only: codec supports tunneled playback.

remarks.para: video or audio decoder only: codec supports tunneled playback.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function IsFeatureRequired (name As String) As Boolean
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsFeatureRequired(string name) cil managed

remarks.para: Query codec feature requirements.
These features are required to be used by the codec, and as such, they are always turned on.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function IsFeatureSupported (name As String) As Boolean
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsFeatureSupported(string name) cil managed

remarks.para: Query codec feature capabilities.
These features are supported to be used by the codec. These include optional features that can be turned on, as well as features that are always on.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function IsFormatSupported (format As MediaFormat) As Boolean
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsFormatSupported(class Android.Media.MediaFormat format) cil managed

Docs.param: media format with optional feature directives.
Docs.summary: Query whether codec supports a given MediaFormat.
Docs.returns: whether the codec capabilities support the given format and feature requests.

remarks.para:
Query whether codec supports a given MediaFormat.

Note: On android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#LOLLIPOP, format must not contain a MediaFormat#KEY_FRAME_RATE frame rate. Use format.setString(MediaFormat.KEY_FRAME_RATE, null) to clear any existing frame rate setting in the format.

The following table summarizes the format keys considered by this method. This is especially important to consider when targeting a higher SDK version than the minimum SDK version, as this method will disregard some keys on devices below the target SDK version.
OS Version(s) MediaFormat keys considered for
Audio Codecs Video Codecs Encoders
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#LOLLIPOP MediaFormat#KEY_MIME*,
MediaFormat#KEY_SAMPLE_RATE,
MediaFormat#KEY_CHANNEL_COUNT,		 MediaFormat#KEY_MIME*,
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_AdaptivePlaybackD,
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_SecurePlaybackD,
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_TunneledPlaybackD,
MediaFormat#KEY_WIDTH,
MediaFormat#KEY_HEIGHT,
no KEY_FRAME_RATE		 as to the left, plus
MediaFormat#KEY_BITRATE_MODE,
MediaFormat#KEY_PROFILE (and/or MediaFormat#KEY_AAC_PROFILE~),
MediaFormat#KEY_COMPLEXITY (and/or MediaFormat#KEY_FLAC_COMPRESSION_LEVEL~)
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#LOLLIPOP_MR1 as above, plus
MediaFormat#KEY_FRAME_RATE
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#M
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#N as above, plus
MediaFormat#KEY_PROFILE,
MediaFormat#KEY_BIT_RATE		 as above, plus
MediaFormat#KEY_PROFILE,
MediaFormat#KEY_LEVEL+,
MediaFormat#KEY_BIT_RATE,
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_IntraRefreshE
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#N_MR1
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#O as above, plus
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_PartialFrameD
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#O_MR1
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#P
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#Q as above, plus
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_FrameParsingD,
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_MultipleFrames,
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_DynamicTimestamp
android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#R as above, plus
CodecCapabilities#FEATURE_LowLatencyD

Notes:
*: must be specified; otherwise, method returns false.
+: method does not verify that the format parameters are supported by the specified level.
D: decoders only
E: encoders only
~: if both keys are provided values must match
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MaxSupportedInstances As Integer
public: property int MaxSupportedInstances { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the max number of the supported concurrent codec instances.

remarks.para: Returns the max number of the supported concurrent codec instances.

This is a hint for an upper bound. Applications should not expect to successfully operate more instances than the returned value, but the actual number of concurrently operable instances may be less as it depends on the available resources at time of use.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
